metadata.description:
This data set contains meteorological element observation data of huazhaizi desert station in the middle reaches of heihe hydrological meteorological observation network from January 1, 2016 to December 31, 2016.The station is located in huazhaizi, zhangye city, gansu province.The latitude and longitude of huazhaizi station is 100.3201E, 38.7659N and 1731m above sea level.The observation items include: air temperature and relative humidity sensors at 5m and 10m, facing due north;Install the barometer inside the waterproof box;The tilting bucket rain gauge is installed at 10m;The wind speed and direction sensor is set at 5m and 10m, facing due north;The four-component radiometer is installed at 6m, facing due south;Two infrared thermometers are installed at 6m, facing due south, and the probe facing vertically downward;The soil temperature probe is buried at 0cm of the surface and 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 60cm and 100cm underground, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The soil water sensor is buried 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 60cm and 100cm underground, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The soil hot plates (3 pieces) are buried 6cm underground.Specific observation elements are as follows:
Air temperature and humidity (Ta_5m RH_5m Ta_10m, RH_10m) (unit: c, percentage), pressure (Press) (unit: hundred mpa), precipitation (Rain) (unit: mm), wind speed (WS_5m, WS_10m) (unit: m/s), wind (WD_10m) (unit: degrees), the radiation of four component (DR, UR, DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor, Rn) (unit: watts per square meter), the surface radiation temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2) (unit:C), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, Gs_3) (in watts/m2), soil moisture (Ms_2cm, Ms_4cm, Ms_10cm, Ms_20cm, Ms_40cm, Ms_60cm, Ms_100cm) (unit: volumetric water content, percentage), and soil temperature (Ts_0cm, Ts_2cm, Ts_4cm, Ts_10cm, Ts_40cm, Ts_60cm, Ts_100cm) (unit: Celsius).
Processing and quality control of observation data :(1) ensure 144 data elements of observation data every day (every 10min), and mark by -6999 in case of data missing;Due to the problem of the wind speed and direction sensor, the observed wind speed of 10m was missing between December and January 29, 2016;The data of soil heat flux G2 was missing from July 5 to August 17 due to the probe problem.(2) excluding the time with duplicate records;(3) data that obviously exceeds the physical significance or the range of the instrument is deleted;(4) the part marked with red letter in the data is the data in question;(5) date and time have the same format, and date and time are in the same column.For example, the time is: 2016-6-10-10:30;(6) the naming rule is: AWS+ site name.
For information of hydrometeorological network or station, please refer to Li et al. (2013), and for observation data processing, please refer to Liu et al. (2011).
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2016年1月1日至2016年12月31日黑河水文气象观测网中游花寨子荒漠站气象要素观测数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市花寨子，下垫面是山前荒漠。花寨子站的经纬度为100.3201E, 38.7659N，海拔1731m。观测项目包括：空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在5m、10m处，朝向正北；气压计安装防水箱内；翻斗式雨量计安装在10m处；风速风向传感器架设在5m、10m，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm和100cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分传感器分别埋设在地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm和100cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处。具体观测要素如下：
空气温湿度（Ta_5m、RH_5m、Ta_10m、RH_10m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_5m、WS_10m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_10m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_60cm、Ms_100cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)和土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_60cm、Ts_100cm）（单位：摄氏度）。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保观测数据要素每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；由于风速风向传感器的问题，观测的10m风速在2016.1.12-1.29之间数据缺失；土壤热通量G2在7月5日-8月17日由于探头问题，数据缺失；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2016-6-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，当EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在能量平衡闭合不完整时，这一任务变得更加困难。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。在这封信中，显示出与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计。这通常对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，另一个因素是该地区强烈的对流环境。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观察比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，通过一系列TSEB模型来估算蒸散发（E）、温度（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），并随后结合稳定氧和氢同位素技术以及涡度相关（EC）测量来更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的，这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还因为在灌溉农田中，当平均H较小时，EC系统的不确定性达到了18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的气温、风速、湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用10 Hz采样频率的EC系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的显热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组件温度是通过热像仪获得的图像计算得出的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于蒸散发的比率。这是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，旨在研究异质土地表面的蒸散发，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值非常一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上的放大是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验旨在通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而应对这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次强烈观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层级嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个EC塔和四个两层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙质沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了强烈观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了LiDAR、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区大约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是其经济发展的基础，尤其是在中国西部，该地区自古以来就是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠地区已被先前研究者发现是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频繁发生，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013），咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据是通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，风速和风向的梯度；以及气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面）是通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测的，同时还包括地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Disjunctive.AnswerEn: Ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures and high-resolution thermal camera data

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced in data collection for estimating evapotranspiration in arid regions?
Example.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区估算蒸散发时面临的一个数据收集挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a challenge in this domain is the difficulty in accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area, where the eddy covariance flux measurements of sensible heat (H) and latent heat (LE) have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy. Additionally, errors in derived component temperatures, caused by image classification errors and other factors, pose significant challenges.
Example.AnswerCn: 在这个领域中的一个挑战是，在强对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量的困难，其中涡动协方差通量测量的显热（H）和潜热（LE）与可用能量之间存在能量平衡闭合不完全的问题。此外，由于图像分类错误和其他因素导致的派生组件温度的误差也带来了重大挑战。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you provide an example of a dataset used for studying evapotranspiration in heterogeneous land surfaces?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个用于研究异质土地表面蒸散发的数据集示例？
Example.AnswerEn: A dataset example for studying evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces is from the Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER), which includes a multiscale dataset obtained from an oasis-desert area. This dataset comprises flux observation matrix data from eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, eco-hydrological sensor networks, and hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing data.
Example.AnswerCn: 一个用于研究异质土地表面蒸散发的数据集示例来自于黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER），该数据集包括从绿洲-沙漠地区获得的多尺度数据。该数据集包含来自涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站、生态水文传感器网络和超高分辨率航空遥感数据的通量观测矩阵数据。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the challenges in measuring energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在测量绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换时面临的挑战有哪些？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: poor availability of multiscale observations, complexity of oasis-desert interactions, need for long-term data, ecological environment degradation
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测的可用性差，绿洲-沙漠相互作用的复杂性，对长期数据的需求，生态环境退化。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the properties of datasets used to study evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 用于研究异质景观中蒸散发的数据库的属性是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: ground-based measurements of soil and canopy component temperatures, soil heat flux, latent and sensible heat fluxes, high-resolution thermal camera images, data from eddy covariance systems, hydrometeorological observations
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 地面测量的土壤和冠层组成部分温度、土壤热通量、潜热和显热通量、高分辨率热成像相机图像、涡度相关系统数据、水文气象观测。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the significance of using a two-source energy balance (TSEB) model in estimating evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces?
Definition.QuestionCn: 使用双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型在异质土地表面估算蒸散发的重要性是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model is significant for estimating evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration because it accounts for the heterogeneity of land surfaces by considering both soil and vegetation components separately. This model helps in accurately estimating surface evapotranspiration, which is crucial for understanding the terrestrial water cycle and managing water resources.
Definition.AnswerCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型在估算蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发方面具有重要意义，因为它通过分别考虑土壤和植被成分来考虑地表的异质性。该模型有助于准确估算表面蒸散发，这对于理解陆地水循环和管理水资源至关重要。

Definition.QuestionEn: How does the HiWATER experiment contribute to the understanding of eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems?
Definition.QuestionCn: HiWATER实验如何有助于理解绿洲-沙漠系统中的生态水文过程？
Definition.AnswerEn: The HiWATER experiment contributes to understanding eco-hydrological processes by providing multiscale and multidisciplinary data through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales. It offers a comprehensive observation system including eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations, which capture interactions between oasis and desert ecosystems and help address challenges in upscaling processes on heterogeneous surfaces.
Definition.AnswerCn: HiWATER实验通过在分层嵌套尺度上提供多尺度和多学科的数据，促进了对生态水文过程的理解。它提供了一个综合观测系统，包括涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站，这些设备捕捉了绿洲与沙漠生态系统之间的相互作用，并帮助解决在异质表面上过程上升尺度的挑战。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in challenges faced during the data collection for evapotranspiration estimation in arid regions versus oasis-desert interactions in eco-hydrological studies?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区与绿洲-沙漠相互作用的生态水文学研究中，蒸散发估算的数据收集面临的挑战有哪些不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: For evapotranspiration estimation in arid regions, challenges include the difficulty of ground measurements of evaporation and transpiration, especially due to image classification errors and the need for accurate temperature separation. In contrast, data collection for oasis-desert interactions faces challenges related to the poor availability of multiscale observations and environmental degradation issues, such as drying rivers and degraded vegetation, impacting the stability of ecological observations.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，蒸散发估算面临的挑战包括蒸发和蒸腾的地面测量困难，特别是由于图像分类错误和需要准确的温度分离。相比之下，关于绿洲-沙漠相互作用的数据收集面临的挑战与多尺度观测的稀缺性和环境退化问题有关，例如干涸的河流和退化的植被，影响生态观测的稳定性。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How might the hierarchical instrumentation on nested scales contribute to understanding eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 嵌套尺度上的分层仪器如何有助于理解绿洲-沙漠系统中的生态水文过程？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The hierarchical instrumentation on nested scales allows for capturing multi-scale eco-hydrological processes by arranging instruments in the oasis-desert system. This structure helps in collecting data at various scales, providing a comprehensive understanding of interactions between different landscapes, such as sandy deserts, desert pavements, and irrigated farmland. Such a detailed dataset can improve model accuracy and reveal intricate patterns in energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange, supporting ecological security and sustainable development in oasis areas.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 分层仪器在嵌套尺度上的应用能够捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，通过在绿洲-沙漠系统中布置仪器。这种结构有助于在不同尺度上收集数据，从而全面理解不同景观之间的相互作用，如沙质沙漠、沙漠铺装和灌溉农田。这种详细的数据集可以提高模型的准确性，并揭示能量、水汽和碳交换中的复杂模式，支持绿洲地区的生态安全和可持续发展。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges in data collection might arise from attempting to measure energy and water vapor exchange in strongly advective agricultural areas, and how can these be addressed?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在强烈对流的农业区域，测量能量和水汽交换时可能会出现哪些数据收集挑战，以及如何应对这些挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: In strongly advective agricultural areas, challenges include incomplete energy balance closure and errors in surface-air temperature difference measurements. These can be addressed by using robust models like the TSEB model, which requires accurate component temperature calculations to estimate energy and water vapor exchanges. Ground-based measurements, such as those from eddy covariance systems, along with high-resolution thermal imagery, can help refine these estimates by providing detailed input data that accounts for the advective influences.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 在强对流农业区域，挑战包括能量平衡闭合不完全和表面-空气温度差测量误差。这些问题可以通过使用像TSEB模型这样的稳健模型来解决，该模型需要准确的组分温度计算，以估计能量和水蒸气交换。地面测量，如涡度协方差系统的测量，以及高分辨率热成像，可以通过提供详细的输入数据来帮助精炼这些估计，从而考虑对流影响。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the challenges of accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在强对流灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量的挑战因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Factors contributing to challenges in estimating surface fluxes include the incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy, uncertainty in surface-air temperature differences, errors in determining soil and vegetation component temperatures, and strong advective environments.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 估算表面通量面临的挑战因素包括可用能量的能量平衡闭合不完全、表面与空气温度差异的不确定性、土壤和植被组分温度确定中的误差，以及强的平流环境。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it difficult to achieve a balance between oasis and desert systems for sustainable oasis development?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么在可持续绿洲发展中实现绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡是困难的？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The difficulty in balancing oasis and desert systems arises from ecological environment degradation, such as drying rivers and lakes, vegetation degradation, land desertification, and dust storms, particularly in inland river basins westward along the Silk Road.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 平衡绿洲和沙漠系统的困难源于生态环境退化，例如河流和湖泊干涸、植被退化、土地沙漠化以及沙尘暴，特别是在丝绸之路向西的内陆河流流域。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the poor availability of multiscale observations in eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致异质表面生态水文过程多尺度观测稀缺的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The poor availability of multiscale observations is due to the complexity of capturing multi-scale eco-hydrological processes and the lack of instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to provide comprehensive data across different landscapes and conditions.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测的稀缺性是由于捕捉多尺度生态水文过程的复杂性，以及在分层嵌套尺度上缺乏仪器以提供不同景观和条件下的全面数据。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of integrating multiscale observations in understanding eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 整合多尺度观测在理解绿洲-沙漠系统中的生态水文过程的潜在后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating multiscale observations can enhance the understanding of eco-hydrological processes by providing comprehensive data across different scales and disciplines. This approach can help overcome the challenge of poor availability of multiscale observations, thereby improving the recognition of oasis-desert interactions and supporting ecological stability and socioeconomic development.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 整合多尺度观测可以通过提供跨不同尺度和学科的综合数据来增强对生态水文过程的理解。这种方法可以帮助克服多尺度观测可用性差的挑战，从而改善对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的认识，并支持生态稳定和社会经济发展。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What might be the impact on data quality when employing a series of data processing techniques for observing energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges in oasis-desert areas?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在观察绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换时，采用一系列数据处理技术可能对数据质量产生的影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Employing a series of data processing techniques could improve data quality by ensuring accurate and reliable measurements of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges. It involves careful quality control through sensor calibration, data collection, processing, and archiving, which are essential for maintaining the integrity and usability of the datasets.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 采用一系列数据处理技术可以通过确保能源、水汽和碳交换的准确和可靠测量来提高数据质量。这涉及通过传感器校准、数据收集、处理和归档进行仔细的质量控制，这对于维护数据集的完整性和可用性至关重要。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What could be the outcomes of using high-precision thermal infrared cameras for separating soil and vegetation component temperatures in strongly advective agricultural areas?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在强烈的对流农业区域使用高精度热红外相机分离土壤和植被成分温度的结果可能是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using high-precision thermal infrared cameras to separate soil and vegetation component temperatures can lead to reliable estimates of evaporation and transpiration ratios, as well as latent heat fluxes. This method helps in accurately partitioning evapotranspiration into its components, thus improving the performance of models like TSEB in such environments.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用高精度热红外相机分离土壤和植被成分的温度，可以可靠地估算蒸发和蒸腾比率，以及潜热通量。这种方法有助于准确划分蒸散发的各个组成部分，从而提高TSEB等模型在此类环境中的性能。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the primary goals of employing a two-source energy balance model for estimating evapotranspiration in vegetation-covered landscapes?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 采用双源能量平衡模型估算植被覆盖景观中的蒸散发的主要目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goal is to improve the estimation of evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration, which are crucial for understanding the terrestrial water cycle and managing water resources. The model aims to account for the heterogeneous nature of soil and vegetation surfaces, providing more accurate surface evapotranspiration estimates compared to one-source models.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是改善蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发的估算，这对于理解陆地水循环和管理水资源至关重要。该模型旨在考虑土壤和植被表面的异质性，相比于单源模型，提供更准确的表面蒸散发估算。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the significance of maintaining long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中维持能量、水汽和碳交换的长期观测有什么重要意义？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goal is to support the ecological security and sustainable development of oases by understanding the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange dynamics. Long-term observations are essential for recognizing oasis-desert interactions, achieving carbon neutrality goals, and mitigating ecological degradation challenges in inland river basins.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是通过理解绿洲的能量、水汽和碳交换动态，支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展。长期观测对于识别绿洲与沙漠的相互作用、实现碳中和目标以及缓解内陆河流域生态退化挑战至关重要。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What techniques and instruments are used to measure soil temperature and moisture at various depths in an arid region observational network?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区观测网络中，用于测量不同深度土壤温度和湿度的技术和仪器有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The observational network employs soil temperature probes buried at the surface and at various depths (2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 60cm, and 100cm) and soil moisture sensors at similar depths. These sensors are positioned at a distance of 2m south of the meteorological tower to ensure accurate readings.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 观测网络使用埋在地表及不同深度（2厘米、4厘米、10厘米、20厘米、40厘米、60厘米和100厘米）的土壤温度探头，以及在类似深度的土壤湿度传感器。这些传感器位于气象塔南侧2米的距离，以确保读数的准确性。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are meteorological parameters such as air temperature, wind speed, and radiation systematically observed and recorded in a hydrometeorological study?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在水文气象研究中，空气温度、风速和辐射等气象参数是如何系统地观测和记录的？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Meteorological parameters are recorded every 10 minutes using sensors mounted at different heights on a meteorological tower. These include air temperature and humidity sensors at 5m and 10m, anemometers for wind speed at 5m and 10m, and a four-component radiometer at 6m for radiation measurements.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 气象参数每10分钟通过安装在不同高度气象塔上的传感器记录。这些参数包括5米和10米处的空气温度和湿度传感器、5米和10米处的风速仪，以及6米处的四分量辐射计用于辐射测量。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What is the process involved in ensuring data quality control and handling missing or erroneous data in a large-scale hydrometeorological dataset?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在大规模水文气象数据集中确保数据质量控制和处理缺失或错误数据所涉及的过程是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Data quality control involves multiple steps: ensuring the presence of 144 data entries per day, marking missing data with a specified value (-6999), removing duplicate records, and deleting data outside physical meaning or instrument range. Additionally, any data with potential issues are highlighted, and a consistent date-time format is maintained.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 数据质量控制涉及多个步骤：确保每天有144个数据条目，使用指定值（-6999）标记缺失数据，删除重复记录，以及删除超出物理意义或仪器范围的数据。此外，任何可能存在问题的数据都会被标记，并保持一致的日期时间格式。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions are necessary for effectively using thermal infrared cameras to capture soil and canopy component temperatures in heterogeneous landscapes?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 有效使用热红外相机捕捉异质景观中土壤和冠层成分温度所需的条件是什么？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Effective use of thermal infrared cameras requires a stable platform for mounting the camera, appropriate calibration to account for atmospheric effects, and clear sky conditions to ensure accurate temperature readings. Additionally, high-resolution imagery is necessary to differentiate between soil and canopy components, and classification methods such as the maximum-likelihood method are needed to separate and analyze these components accurately.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 有效使用热红外相机需要一个稳定的平台来安装相机，适当的校准以考虑大气影响，以及良好的天气条件以确保温度读数的准确性。此外，高分辨率图像对于区分土壤和树冠成分是必要的，并且需要使用最大似然法等分类方法来准确分离和分析这些成分。

Enablement.QuestionEn: In what ways can a multiscale observation system enhance the understanding of eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 多尺度观测系统可以通过哪些方式增强对绿洲-沙漠系统中生态水文过程的理解？
Enablement.AnswerEn: A multiscale observation system enables a comprehensive understanding of eco-hydrological processes by integrating data from various scales, such as flux observation matrices, remote sensing instruments, and ground measurements. This approach captures interactions between different landscape components, providing detailed insights into energy, water, and carbon exchanges and facilitating the development of scalable models that address the complexities of oasis-desert ecosystems.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测系统通过整合来自不同尺度的数据，如通量观测矩阵、遥感仪器和地面测量，能够全面理解生态水文过程。这种方法捕捉了不同景观组件之间的相互作用，提供了关于能量、水和碳交换的详细见解，并促进了可扩展模型的开发，以应对绿洲-沙漠生态系统的复杂性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might data collection methods in oasis-desert areas face challenges related to multiscale observations?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么在绿洲-沙漠地区的数据收集方法可能面临与多尺度观测相关的挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Progress is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations, which is a significant challenge in the field. The complexity of capturing eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces requires instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain comprehensive data.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 进展受到多尺度观测可用性差的阻碍，这是该领域的一大挑战。捕捉异质表面上的生态水文过程的复杂性需要在分层嵌套的尺度上进行仪器布置，以获得全面的数据。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might comprehensive datasets involving energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange be critical for understanding oasis-desert interactions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么包含能量、水汽和碳交换的综合数据集对于理解绿洲-沙漠相互作用至关重要？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Comprehensive datasets are crucial because understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems is essential for achieving sustainable development. Such datasets allow for the recognition of oasis-desert interactions, which is significant for ecological stability and socioeconomic development.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 综合数据集至关重要，因为了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征对于实现可持续发展至关重要。这些数据集使得识别绿洲-沙漠相互作用成为可能，这对生态稳定和社会经济发展具有重要意义。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How effective are the current data collection methods in capturing multiscale eco-hydrological processes in heterogeneous landscapes?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 当前的数据收集方法在捕捉异质景观中的多尺度生态水文过程方面的有效性如何？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The current data collection methods, such as those used in the HiWATER experiment, utilize hierarchically nested scales and a combination of ground-based and remote sensing technologies to address the challenge of capturing multiscale eco-hydrological processes. By integrating eddy covariance towers, meteorological stations, and advanced remote sensing techniques like LiDAR and thermal imaging, these methods effectively capture data across different scales and landscapes, offering a comprehensive approach to understanding eco-hydrological interactions.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 当前的数据收集方法，如HiWATER实验中使用的方法，采用分层嵌套的尺度以及地面和遥感技术的结合，以应对捕捉多尺度生态水文过程的挑战。通过整合涡度协方差塔、气象站以及先进的遥感技术，如激光雷达和热成像，这些方法有效地在不同尺度和景观中捕获数据，提供了理解生态水文相互作用的综合方法。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How might data collection strategies be improved to better support long-term monitoring of oasis–desert interactions and their impact on carbon cycles?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何改进数据收集策略，以更好地支持对绿洲-沙漠相互作用及其对碳循环影响的长期监测？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Improving data collection strategies could involve expanding the network of observation stations to cover more diverse landscapes within oasis-desert systems and incorporating more advanced technologies to measure carbon fluxes accurately. Long-term monitoring can be enhanced by integrating satellite-based observations with ground-based data, ensuring comprehensive spatial and temporal coverage. Additionally, employing machine learning techniques to analyze and predict trends from the collected data could provide deeper insights into oasis-desert interactions and their impact on carbon cycles.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 改善数据收集策略可以包括扩大观测站网络，以覆盖更多样化的绿洲-沙漠系统景观，并结合更先进的技术以准确测量碳通量。通过将卫星观测与地面数据相结合，可以增强长期监测，确保全面的空间和时间覆盖。此外，采用机器学习技术分析和预测收集的数据趋势，可以为绿洲-沙漠相互作用及其对碳循环的影响提供更深入的见解。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how component temperatures of soil and vegetation are accurately determined in a strongly advective agricultural area.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白在强对流的农业区域中，土壤和植被的组成温度是如何准确确定的。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Component temperatures of soil and vegetation are determined using thermal infrared cameras, with images classified into soil and canopy pixels. The component temperatures are calculated by converting thermal infrared temperatures to radiometric temperatures, validated against surface temperatures observed by a four-component radiometer.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 土壤和植被的组成温度通过热红外相机测定，图像被分类为土壤像素和冠层像素。组成温度通过将热红外温度转换为辐射温度来计算，并与四组件辐射计观测到的表面温度进行验证。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how long-term data of energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes are managed for accuracy and quality control.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解长期的能量、水蒸气和碳通量数据是如何管理以确保准确性和质量控制的。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Long-term data of energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes are managed through a structured process that includes data collection, processing, and archiving. This includes quality control measures like sensor calibration and handling of data from various sources including eddy covariance systems and automatic weather stations with specific measurement intervals.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 长期的能量、水汽和碳通量数据通过一个结构化的过程进行管理，包括数据收集、处理和归档。这包括质量控制措施，如传感器校准，以及处理来自不同来源的数据，包括涡度协方差系统和具有特定测量间隔的自动气象站。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the challenges faced in the data collection process for eco-hydrological observations in oasis-desert systems and propose potential solutions to address these challenges.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请分析在绿洲-沙漠系统中进行生态水文观测的数据收集过程中面临的挑战，并提出潜在的解决方案来应对这些挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges in collecting eco-hydrological data in oasis-desert systems include the poor availability of multiscale observations and the ecological degradation in arid areas. Solutions may involve implementing hierarchically nested scales of instrumentation, as seen in HiWATER, to capture multi-scale processes, and ensuring continuous, intensive observations with a combination of ground-based and remote sensing techniques to improve data availability and quality.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中收集生态水文数据的挑战包括多尺度观测的可用性差和干旱地区的生态退化。解决方案可能涉及实施分层嵌套的仪器尺度，如HiWATER，以捕捉多尺度过程，并确保通过结合地面观测和遥感技术进行连续、密集的观测，以提高数据的可用性和质量。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please evaluate the effectiveness of different data collection methods used for measuring energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in arid regions, particularly in oasis-desert areas.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请评估在干旱地区，特别是在绿洲-沙漠地区，用于测量能量、水蒸气和碳通量的不同数据收集方法的有效性。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Data collection methods in arid regions, especially oasis-desert areas, involve using eddy covariance systems, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations to measure energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes. These are supplemented by hydrometeorological data and remote sensing tools like LiDAR and thermal imagers. The effectiveness lies in their ability to provide comprehensive datasets that cover both the spatial and temporal dynamics necessary to understand these fluxes.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，特别是绿洲-沙漠地区，数据收集方法包括使用涡度协方差系统、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站来测量能量、水蒸气和碳通量。这些方法还辅以水文气象数据和遥感工具，如激光雷达（LiDAR）和热成像仪。其有效性在于能够提供全面的数据集，涵盖理解这些通量所需的空间和时间动态。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please propose strategies for enhancing the quality and reliability of datasets related to hydrometeorological observations in arid and semiarid regions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请提出增强干旱和半干旱地区水文气象观测数据集质量和可靠性的策略。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Enhancing the quality and reliability of datasets can be achieved through meticulous quality control measures, including sensor calibration, data processing, and error checking. Implementing a combination of high-resolution airborne remote sensing and synchronized ground measurements, as well as ensuring data sharing through platforms like the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center, can further improve dataset reliability and accessibility.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 提高数据集的质量和可靠性可以通过细致的质量控制措施来实现，包括传感器校准、数据处理和错误检查。实施高分辨率的航空遥感与同步的地面测量相结合，以及通过国家西藏高原数据中心等平台确保数据共享，可以进一步提高数据集的可靠性和可获取性。
